titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Decreta. Prim Pars. Dist XXXVIII, c.13. [i.143]

This is an exact ecclesiastical parallel to the famous exclamation of Sigismund: "Ego [sum] rex Romannorum sum et super grammaticam". It is taken from a letter addressed by Gregory to the Bishop Leander.
Venustatem, dissimulare cam debet et fugere,
Ut non otiosis philosophorem scolis paucisque
discipulis, sed universo loquatur hominum generi'.
Although the Church's instruction has the
charm of eloquence, yet it ought to conceal &
avoid that charm, so that it may appeal, not
to the leisured schools of philosophers, & to a
few educated folk, but to the whole human race.
This is taken from S. Jerome's letter to Pammachius
